DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to identify the amount of radioisotope injected for a bone scan imaging procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A nuclear imaging method used to evaluate pathological bone metabolism._An unstable element that releases radiation as it breaks down. Radioisotopes can be used in imaging tests or as a treatment for cancer._The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A nuclear imaging method used to evaluate pathological bone metabolism.

Concepts.definition: A nuclear imaging method used to evaluate pathological bone metabolism.

Property.preferredDefinition: An unstable element that releases radiation as it breaks down. Radioisotopes can be used in imaging tests or as a treatment for cancer.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: A version of a chemical element that has an unstable nucleus and emits radiation during its decay to a stable form. (online dictionary)
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Activity of radiotracer measured in milliCuries (mCi)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Substances having the same number of protons in their nuclei and hence having the same atomic number, but differing in the number of neutrons and therefore, in the mass number.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A form of a chemical element containing a specific number of neutrons and a specific atomic mass.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/14/13 Removed caBIG-ACRIN CSI; added equivalent PET modality CSI. jc  3/11/11-VD versioned max size changed to 7; dose qualifier removed captured in DEC. 3/5/08 - released for UoWASH FES CRF.  3/3/08-update decimal representation per ACRIN call w/Pam & Judy to 2 decimals to the right (nn.nn)  12/21/07 created for use in ACRIN PET CDEs; Univ of  Washington FES, FMISO studies

DataElement.changeDescription: 3/11/11 CDE versioned because VD was versioned. 3/26/2010 Curated to support MGH Imaging trial
